title: Retro Swimming Heroes
description: Dive into the pool of memories and recall the swimming champions who made a splash from the 1940s through the 1980s!

questions.question: Mark Spitz made Olympic history in 1972 by winning how many gold medals at the Munich Games?
Mark Spitz was famous for competing in the Olympics while sporting what distinctive facial feature?
Which Australian swimmer, known as 'The Golden Girl,' won the 100m freestyle at the 1956 Melbourne Olympics at age 16?
Dawn Fraser won the Olympic 100m freestyle at three consecutive Olympics. Which years?
Johnny Weissmuller, who won five Olympic gold medals in swimming, later became famous for playing which movie character?
Esther Williams, known as 'America's Mermaid,' was a competitive swimmer who became a star in what type of movie?
Which American swimmer won gold in the 400m and 1500m freestyle at the 1968 Olympics and was known for his powerful kick?
Don Schollander became the first swimmer to win four gold medals at a single Olympics in which year?
Shane Gould of Australia won three individual gold medals at the 1972 Munich Olympics at what young age?
Which East German female swimmer dominated the 1976 and 1980 Olympics, though her country's results were later tainted by doping revelations?
The 1976 Montreal Olympics saw which American swimmer become the youngest Olympic swimming champion at age 15?
Which legendary Hawaiian swimmer and water polo player is considered the father of modern surfing?
Buster Crabbe won an Olympic gold medal in swimming in 1932 and then went on to star as which movie serial character?
Tracy Caulkins, one of America's greatest swimmers, won how many U.S. national titles during her career in the late 1970s and 1980s?
The United States boycotted the 1980 Moscow Olympics, preventing many swimmers from competing. Which country hosted the next Olympics in 1984?
